Article Title: Who is Alia Abdul-Raheem? NYC bystander recounts terrifying moment she was shot, ‘I looked down and there’s a hole’
Article Text:
Representative Image

The ordinary walk home turned into a nightmare for 32-year-old Alia Abdul-Raheem , who was struck by a stray bullet during an apparent drive-by shooting in Brooklyn on Tuesday evening. The chilling experience left her physically sore, mentally shaken, and calling for stricter gun control.Abdul-Raheem, who works at a record label, was walking along Malcolm X Boulevard toward her Bedford-Stuyvesant home around 7 pm when the sound of gunfire shattered the evening calm.“I looked up and I saw a car driving by pretty fast, and the windows were down, and it sounds like the gunshots are coming from the car,” Abdul-Raheem told the New York Post the following day.Moments later, she felt the unthinkable.“I just felt this, like this hit on my chest, and I looked down, and there’s a hole in my coat, through my shirt,” she recalled.In shock, Abdul-Raheem hurried home, trying to process what had just happened.“At the time, I couldn’t feel any blood. I didn’t really know what had just happened. I was just in pain and kind of shocked, and I continued to walk home.”When she arrived, her sister’s reaction confirmed the severity of the situation.“My sister opened up my coat and she could see the big gash and wounds on my chest,” she said.Abdul-Raheem rushed to New York Presbyterian’s emergency room, where medical staff acted swiftly. Fortunately, the bullet had only grazed her chest, leaving her shaken but alive.“All things considered,” the doctor told her, “it could have been really a lot worse.”The same gunfire also struck a 15-year-old boy, who police believe was the intended target. He was hit in the left ankle on Chauncey Street near Malcolm X Boulevard and is currently in stable condition.The incident has left Abdul-Raheem, who has lived in the neighborhood for eight years, feeling uneasy about her once-familiar commute.“It’s scary. I’m a bit shaken up,” she admitted, adding that walking the same route will be difficult for a while.She also expressed frustration and sadness over the broader implications of the violence.“The kid who was shot was 15. I could tell the kids were young. They don’t even know what they’re doing — why [do they have] guns?” she asked.“It was 7 o’clock on a Tuesday. If we had better gun control, this would have never happened.”Police have made no arrests as of Thursday morning. The investigation into the shooting remains ongoing.For Abdul-Raheem, the incident is a stark reminder of how quickly life can change — and a call for action to address gun violence in the city.
Article Summary: Alia Abdul-Raheem, 32, was struck by a stray bullet during an apparent drive-by shooting in Brooklyn on Tuesday evening. The bullet grazed her chest, leaving her shaken but alive. The same gunfire also struck a 15-year-old boy, who police believe was the intended target.

Article Title: Why did Hindenburg Research, short-seller behind Adani Group $150 bn rout, shut down? Read full text of founder Nate Anderson’s personal note
Article Text:
Hindenburg rose to international prominence after publishing damaging reports about Indian industrialist Gautam Adani.

Poll What Do You Think About Hindenburg Research Shutting Down? Surprising Decision After Major Revelations A Bold Move After a History of Impactful Reports

Why has Hindenburg Research shut down?

Below is the full text of his personal note:

As I’ve shared with family, friends and our team since late last year, I have made the decision to disband Hindenburg Research. The plan has been to wind up after we finished the pipeline of ideas we were working on. And as of the last Ponzi cases we just completed and are sharing with regulators, that day is today.

I write this from a place of joy. Building this has been a life’s dream.

I did not know at the outset if it would be possible to find a fulfilling path. This wasn’t an easy option, but I was naïve to the danger and felt drawn to it magnetically.

When I started this, I doubted I was capable. I didn’t have a traditional finance background. None of my relatives are in this field. I went to a state school. I’m not a slick salesperson. I don’t know any of the right clothes to wear. I can’t play golf. I’m not some superhuman that can function on 4 hours of sleep. In most of my jobs I was a good worker but mostly looked over. I had no money when I started—and after catching 3 lawsuits immediately out of the gate, I quickly had less than no money. I would have failed right at the starting line had it not been for the support of world-class whistleblower lawyer Bryan Wood, who took the cases on despite my lack of financial resources. I had a newborn child and was facing eviction at the time. I was terrified, but knew that if I stayed still I would crumble. The only option I had was to keep moving forward.

It is very easy to succumb to negative thoughts and believe what others think of you, especially when things feel low. But it is possible to shatter all of that. I was passionate about this and I let that carry me forward despite my fears and insecurities.

And then this slowly started to flourish.

One at a time, and without a clear plan, we built a team of 11 incredible people. I hired each of them not because we needed workers, but because when our paths crossed and I could see who they were, I realized it was madness not to bring them on.

They are all smart, focused, and fun to work with. Little to no ego. When you meet them, they are all very nice and polite. But when it comes to this field, they are ruthless assassins, capable of world-class work. Like me, our team didn’t come from traditional finance backgrounds. My first hire often describes himself as a former bartender. We all have a shared view of the world, a mostly calm exterior, and a similar burning underlying intensity. They are all family to me.

We have all worked extremely hard, with a focus on precision and letting the evidence dictate our words.

Sometimes this meant taking big swings and taking on fights that are much bigger than any of us as individuals. Fraud, corruption, and negativity often seem overwhelming. Early on, a sense of justice was usually elusive. When it happened, it was tremendously fulfilling. It kept us going when we needed it.

And boy did we have an impact, eventually—more than I imagined was possible at the outset. Nearly 100 individuals have been charged civilly or criminally by regulators at least in part through our work, including billionaires and oligarchs. We shook some empires that we felt needed shaking.

Over time, people began to see what I hoped we could show—that having an impact is possible, no matter who you are.

It has also been rather intense, and at times, all-encompassing. I often wake up from my dreams because I’ve thought of a new investigative thread to pull on in my sleep, or an edit that clarifies a point I didn’t realize I was troubled by during the day. Or from the general pressure of it all. We are not fearless—we just have faith in the truth and hope it leads us down the right path.

I’m grateful for all of it. We have days of bizarre, hilarious and ridiculous stories and we’ve had a lot of fun amidst the pressure and challenges. It has been the adventure of a lifetime.

So, why disband now? There is not one specific thing—no particular threat, no health issue, and no big personal issue.

Someone once told me that at a certain point a successful career becomes a selfish act. Early on, I felt I needed to prove some things to myself. I have now finally found some comfort with myself, probably for the first time in my life. I probably could have had it all along had I let myself, but I needed to put myself through a bit of hell first. The intensity and focus has come at the cost of missing a lot of the rest of the world and the people I care about. I now view Hindenburg as a chapter in my life, not a central thing that defines me.

Beyond my own desire for relief, it also feels selfish to keep the knowledge we’ve accumulated trapped within our small team. I have more than enough. In the past several years we’ve been flooded with thousands of messages from many of you asking how we do what we do, or whether you can join the team. I read them all and I’ve been trying to figure out how to respond in a way that can answer everyone—so over the next 6 months or so I plan to work on a series of materials and videos to open-source every aspect of our model and how we conduct our investigations.

My hope is that after we fully share our process, in a couple years I will get an unsolicited message from someone who reads this (maybe you), who embraces the same passion, learns the craft, and finds the confidence to shed some light on a subject that needs it, despite the obstacles in your way. That would make my day, even if I’m off trying to learn music or planting a garden or whatever I end up doing next.

For now, I will be focused on making sure everyone on our team lands where they want to be next. Some are going to start their own research firm, which I will strongly and publicly encourage, even as I will have no personal involvement. There are others on our team who are now free agents—so feel free to reach out to me if you have a need for anyone who is brilliant, focused, and easy to work with, as they all are.

It wasn’t always obvious to me, but I now view all of this as a love story. To my wife, you have been so patient with me. It has not been easy, to put it mildly, and I am forever grateful that you have sacrificed so much and pushed forward with me. And now, my dear, we get to enjoy it together for as long as this world will let us.

To my family and friends, I’m sorry for the times I have ignored you while I let my attention be drawn away. I can’t wait to have more time to share with you together.

Lastly, I want to express how grateful I am to our readers. Your messages of kindness and encouragement through the years have gone a long way to help give us the strength to continue. And it constantly reminds me that the world is filled with good. Thank you for all of it—I couldn’t ask for more. It is all a blessing.

With unfathomable levels of gratitude,

Nate Anderson
Article Summary: Hindenburg Research shut down after more than a year of work. CEO: "I did not know at the outset if it would be possible to find a fulfilling path" "I was terrified, but knew that if I stayed still I would crumble. The only option I had was to keep moving forward"

Article Title: Pope Francis says he had a mischievous youth
Article Text:
AP photo

Pope Francis’ new autobiography traces roots and rise to Vatican

Pope Francis in his recently released autobiography, "Hope: The Autobiography," opened up about his youth, describing himself as a "mischievous child."At 88, the Pope reflected on moments of mischief and regret from his childhood in Buenos Aires, admitting, "I remember my sins and I am ashamed… I am a sinner like everyone else," as reported by AFP.The Pope delved into his family’s immigrant history, sharing the story of his Italian grandparents who moved to Argentina in 1929.With only third-class boat tickets, his grandmother had to hide her possessions in the lining of her jacket. He reflected on this, saying, “There’s nothing new about it. It’s a story of yesterday as much as one of today,” drawing a parallel to the ongoing struggles of migrants.He also shared his surprise at being elected Pope in 2013, admitting that he never imagined himself in this role. Reflecting on the day he was chosen, he wrote, “I had never imagined that the conclave could affect me directly, and in no way could I have thought about a name as pope.”Pope Francis, who has not watched TV since 1990 due to a vow made to the Virgen del Carmen, also revealed the small sacrifices he’s made as Pope, including missing out on watching his favourite football team, San Lorenzo."That evening I was with my community in Buenos Aires, we were watching the TV, and a sordid scene appeared on the screen, which deeply offended me: I got up and left," he said.“Going out for a pizza is one of the small things that I most miss,” he added highlighting the everyday joys he once enjoyed, such as walking the streets and taking the subway.
Article Summary: Pope Francis has released his autobiography, "Hope: The Autobiography" The Pope opened up about his youth, describing himself as a "mischievous child" He also shared his family's immigrant history, saying, "It's a story of yesterday as much as one of today"

Article Title: Meteorite Crash Canada: Historic: Doorbell camera footage captures meteorite crash in Canada
Article Text:
Historic: Doorbell camera footage captures meteorite crash in Canada (Picture credit: X)

Sound and video of meteorite crashing to Earth captured on video in P.E.I.

For the first time, a doorbell camera has captured both the sight and sound of a meteorite striking the Earth, marking a significant milestone in scientific documentation.In July 2024, Joe Velaidum and his partner, Laura Kelly, witnessed the extraordinary event outside their home in Marshfield, Prince Edward Island, according to CBC News.Velaidum’s Ring camera recorded the meteorite's fiery descent and audible impact as it struck the ground just steps from his front door, leaving a dent in the walkway and scattering debris.The meteorite, later identified as an ordinary chondrite, travelled from the asteroid belt between Mars and Jupiter before its fateful collision.After discovering black debris on his property, Velaidum consulted University of Alberta meteorite curator Chris Herd. As per CBC News, Herd confirmed the rock’s extraterrestrial origins and named it the Charlottetown Meteorite , honouring its proximity to the island's capital. In total, 95 grams of fragments were collected, with analysis revealing the rock’s high-speed entry, approximately 60,000 km/h, before slowing to 200 km/h upon impact.“This event is truly unprecedented,” CBC News quoted Herd. “It’s the first time both the sights and sounds of a meteorite impact have been captured. From a science perspective, it’s new.”The recently surfaced video not only provides extraordinary visual but also unique auditory evidence of the meteorite’s collision, a breakthrough for researchers studying these rare phenomena.Velaidum narrowly escaped harm and recounted, “If I’d lingered just minutes longer, I might’ve been standing right in the impact zone. It’s surreal to think that something travelled millions of miles to land right on my doorstep.”The event left Velaidum and Kelly in awe of the cosmos’ unpredictability. “It’s humbling,” Velaidum said, reflecting on the odds of such a close encounter.As per PetaPixel, this meteorite is the first ever documented on Prince Edward Island, adding a unique chapter to the island’s history. Herd emphasised its significance: “Every time this happens, it’s a new sample from space—a testament to the wonders of our universe.”
Article Summary: Sound and video of meteorite crashing to Earth captured on video in P.E.I. Joe Velaidum’s Ring camera recorded the meteorite's fiery descent and audible impact as it struck the ground. The meteorite, later identified as an ordinary chondrite, travelled from the asteroid belt between Mars and Jupiter before its fateful collision.

Article Title: Washing Up Liquid Warning: Irish families urged to rethink washing-up liquid choices amid plastic waste crisis
Article Text: Irish families are being encouraged to reconsider their choice of washing-up liquid products in 2025.Currently, plastic bottles dominate the washing-up liquid market, with annual sales reaching millions of units.Research by Ecover indicates poor recycling rates, with less than 50% of household plastic bottles being collected for recycling, and a mere 7% of these actually completing the recycling process, Galway Beo reported."The resulting impact on waterways and marine life is, to put it bluntly, horrifying – with an estimated 12.7 million tonnes ending up in oceans each year."Why melt a bottle to make a bottle, when you've already got a bottle? Does seem kinda crazy when you say it out loud. But where to start with that reusable plastic bottle?"Be it washing-up liquid, laundry detergent or loo cleaner, you can refill it at one of over 700 Ecover refill stations . Find them at your local health food store, zero waste shop or some bigger supermarkets."Popular brands like Fairy offer an alternative solution through their refill cartons, which provide enough product to refill a standard Fairy liquid bottle "more than twice."
Article Summary: Research by Ecover indicates poor recycling rates, with less than 50% of household plastic bottles being collected for recycling. Popular brands like Fairy offer an alternative solution through their refill cartons, which provide enough product to refill a standard Fairy liquid bottle "more than twice"

Article Title: Meghan Markle pays tribute to late dog featured in Netflix series
Article Text:
In Memory of Guy",

With Love, Meghan

With Love, Meghan

The Duchess of Sussex , Meghan Markle has announced the passing of her beloved dog, Guy, in a heartfelt Instagram tribute, in a post on Tuesday. She shared a touching video montage of her 'sweet' companion, who was scheduled to appear in her upcoming Netflix programme.The Duchess expressed her profound grief, acknowledging countless tears shed whilst thanking her faithful pet for years of unwavering devotion. She titled the tribute "advocating for pet adoption with a compilation of photographs and videos."In 2015, I adopted a beagle from a dog rescue in Canada. He had been at a kill shelter in Kentucky and given a few days to live. I swooped him up….and fell in love. They referred to him as ‘the little guy’ because he was so small and frail, so I named him ‘Guy’. And he was the best guy any girl could have asked for," the mother-of-two said in her post.Meghan continued, "He endured a terrible accident shortly before I moved to the UK which had him undergoing surgeries for several months and unable to leave the clinic. Doctors said he would never walk again, but Dr Noel Fitzpatrick said he could do it. He and I would drive late at night, after hours, to see Guy as he recovered in Surrey for months on end."This marks her third Instagram post since launching her Netflix series on her new account,"If you followed me on Instagram back in the day, you saw a lot of him - and on The Tig too. He was with me at Suits, when I got engaged, (and then married), when I became a mom….he was with me for everything: the quiet, the chaos, the calm, the comfort," she said."Thank you for loving him so much," she wrote, conveying her appreciation to Dr Noel and the team at Queen West Animal Hospital ."As many of you will see Guy in this new series, I hope you’ll understand why his loss has devastated me. I think you might fall a little in love with him too," she further emphasised."I have cried too many tears to count - the type of tears that make you get in the shower with the absurd hope that the running water on your face will somehow make you not feel them, or pretend they’re not there. But they are. And that’s okay too. Thank you for so many years of unconditional love, my sweet Guy. You filled my life in ways you’ll never know," the Suits star added., the anticipated programme, launching on January 15, will showcase the Duchess sharing her expertise in cooking and gardening, the Daily Mail reported.Additionally, viewers might also have noticed a black Labrador in the brief promotional footage for Meghan's Netflix programme - Pula, who joined the family before Archie's arrival in 2019.

She shared a touching video montage of her'sweet' companion, who was scheduled to appear in her upcoming Netflix programme. The anticipated programme, launching on January 15, will showcase the Duchess sharing her expertise in cooking and gardening.

Article Title: Did UK media downplay pakistani grooming gangs scandal? Here's the truth
Article Text:
File photo

Using data to examine the issue

Stark media gap before 2011

The numbers don't lie: Grooming gangs vs other scandals

Relative neglect in the media

Cultural and political taboo

A national scandal that can't be ignored

A call for accountability

Matthew James Goodwin , a prominent British political scientist, recently questioned the media's handling of the UK's grooming gangs scandal, suggesting that it has not received sufficient coverage. His remarks sparked criticism from some journalists, but Goodwin is undeterred. He decided to take a closer look at the data to assess the media’s treatment of the issue.Goodwin used Lexis, a database employed by researchers to track content across UK newspapers, to analyze media coverage from 2011 to 2025. He made sure to account for criticisms, specifically addressing how the term "grooming gangs" is used in the media. His findings, he insists, will shed light on how the scandal has been covered—or neglected.One of Goodwin’s main points is that until 2011, the media largely ignored the grooming gangs crisis, despite widespread rumors and groups like the BNP and EDL pushing it into public discourse. He credited Andrew Norfolk of The Times for starting early coverage, despite facing abuse and harassment. It wasn't until 2011 that any major media outlet seriously began to report on the issue.From 2011 to 2025, Goodwin found a total of 4,659 articles about grooming gangs. On the surface, this may seem like a substantial number, but when compared to coverage of other topics, it appears minimal. For example, the term "white privilege" appeared in 6,146 articles, "anti-Muslim" in 17,152, and "Islamophobia" in 23,461.Goodwin points out that while there were certainly outlets that covered the grooming gangs issue, like The Times, the coverage still pales in comparison to other race-related stories. In fact, newspapers like The Guardian had only 113 articles about grooming gangs during the same period, compared to over 3,000 articles on "Islamophobia."The BBC’s coverage is similarly skewed. Goodwin found 357 specific mentions of grooming gangs in BBC News and Radio 4 transcripts, while George Floyd's case generated over 7,500 mentions, and "Islamophobia" garnered over 2,000.The political scientist believes that the relative media silence on grooming gangs can be attributed to the media’s reluctance to challenge narratives surrounding immigration, multiculturalism, and "diversity." He argues that these topics are too politically sensitive for much of the media to address openly, especially when they might contradict the prevailing liberal views held by the educated elites who control much of the UK’s media.In a passionate appeal, Goodwin credits Elon Musk for forcing the UK to reckon with this national scandal. Thanks to Musk’s influence, millions are now learning about the horrors of the grooming gangs for the first time or discovering new, shocking details. Goodwin believes this newfound awareness will lead the public to ask critical questions: Why was this ignored? Who is accountable? What’s being done to stop it?Goodwin concludes by urging the UK media to confront the scandal head-on. He believes the media must push the issue to the forefront, give it the attention it deserves, and avoid focusing on distractions like the death of a single American man. The British public, he argues, is paying attention, and it’s time for the media to do the same.As Goodwin puts it, “Find the truth and tell us the truth. That’s your job.”
Article Summary: British political scientist Matthew James Goodwin analyzed media coverage from 2011 to 2025. Goodwin found a total of 4,659 articles about grooming gangs. This may seem like a substantial number, but when compared to coverage of other topics, it appears minimal. Goodwin believes the relative media silence on grooming gangs can be attributed to the media’s reluctance to challenge narratives surrounding immigration, multiculturalism, and "diversity"

Article Title: 32-year-old woman declared cancer free after UK’s first liver transplant for advanced bowel cancer
Article Text: Bianca Perea, a 32-year-old trainee lawyer from Manchester, has been declared cancer-free after becoming the first person in the UK to undergo a liver transplant for advanced bowel cancer. In November 2021, the woman was diagnosed with stage four bowel cancer that had spread to her liver. The doctors initially told her the focus would be on prolonging her life rather than finding a cure.Despite the grim prediction, a combined range of treatments including chemotherapy, targeted drug therapy, and surgery helped her defy the odds leaving no signs of cancer anywhere in her body."Within four weeks of going under the knife, I was able to drive and walk the family dogs, it was really quite incredible.” Perea shared, adding, "To go from being told I'd only have a short time to live to now being cancer-free is the greatest gift.According to Sky News, Pera's cancer was diagnosed after she first visited a GP in Wingan, reporting symptoms of constipation and bloating. Following a series of tests, including a colonoscopy and biopsy, the diagnosis was confirmed, revealing that the cancer had spread to all eight segments of her liver.Perea underwent 37 rounds of chemotherapy with the targeted drug panitumumab, showing an excellent response that allowed surgeons to remove her bowel tumour in May 2023. However, tumours remained in her liver, which were initially inoperable. However, after the positive reaction to treatment, doctors began exploring liver transplantation as an option.In February 2024, she was added to the transplant list and fortunately found a donor last summer.Her oncologist, Dr Kalena Marti, praised the outcome, "When we looked at the tumour cells in her liver after it had been removed, they weren't active.”"This is excellent news, and we hope that this means that the cancer won't come back."Dr Marti also highlighted the importance of ongoing research and the generosity of organ donors. "Advanced bowel cancer is complex and there are lots of different types of the disease, so what works for one person might not work for another. As a result, it's important that we continue to develop new treatments.
Article Summary: Bianca Perea, a 32-year-old trainee lawyer from Manchester, has been declared cancer-free. She became the first person in the UK to undergo a liver transplant for advanced bowel cancer. She underwent 37 rounds of chemotherapy with the targeted drug panitumumab. Surgeons removed her bowel tumour in May 2023.

Article Title: Meghan Markle faces backlash for her Netflix lifestyle series; royal fans say, ' Who is the audience?'
Article Text:
Meghan Markle (Picture credit: Netflix X handle)

Mixed reactions from fans

A sneak peek at the show

Meghan Markle’s announcement of her upcoming Netflix lifestyle series With Love, Meghan has sparked mixed reactions online, with many royal fans criticising the show for being "out of touch."The trailer, posted on Markle's Instagram, shows her in her Montecito kitchen and garden, interacting with guests, including Mindy Kaling . Meghan said, "I have been so excited to share this with you! I hope you love the show as much as I loved making it."The series is set to launch on January 15, having been teased last March when Meghan launched her brand, American Riviera Orchard.As the trailer launched, royal fans didn’t seem as enthusiastic as Meghan. Many took to social media platform X to express their discontent, calling the series “terrible” and “privileged.”"Uh no thanks," one user wrote, while another bluntly commented, "This looks terrible." A third added, "Rather watch paint dry." Some felt Meghan was out of touch, criticising her for cooking meals that "nobody can afford right now."One X user summed up the sentiment, saying: "Who is the target audience?? Women with tons of money and time on their hands making extremely fussy treats and crafts? Incredibly entitled."Blogger Meghan McCain also criticised the Duchess of Sussex for being out of touch. "I was originally a Meghan Markle supporter. I thought she was cool, stylish, and refreshing. Like the rest of the world, my opinion changed when she disrespected the royal family. Now that she wants to be American again instead of British aristocracy, what she seems to forget is Americans want real, raw, uncensored," she expressed her disapproval of the Duchess.“All of this, even in the trailer, is highly curated, produced, and out of touch. There have been two terror attacks in two days, major wars raging, and Americans can’t pay for groceries. New RuPay credit card rules : The National Payments Corporation of India (NPCI) has unveiled updates for RuPay Credit Card holders on the Unified Payments Interface (UPI) platform. These include EMI options, credit account bill payments, instalment payments, and limit management. Banks and card issuers have been asked to enable these features by May 31, 2024.As per an ET report, NPCI announced on March 29, that RuPay credit cards and pre-approved credit lines can now be linked on UPI, facilitating secure payment transactions. Article Title: Raising Financially Savvy Kids: Age-Appropriate Money Management Education for the Next Generation
Article Text:
By instilling financial literacy in children today, we are sowing the seeds for a future where they will grow into financially confident adults.

By Tvisha Tuli, Content Creator

Start Early with a Modest Allowance: Consider providing your children with a small monthly allowance that introduces them to the concept of budgeting and the value of earning money through contributing to household chores. Make Saving a Game: Start small, perhaps with a reward system tied to their favorite pastimes. By linking their efforts to tangible rewards, such as completing chores to play video games, the habit of budgeting gets cultivated and seamlessly transitions into saving real money. Teach Budgeting Using the 50:30:20 Rule: This is a simple yet powerful tool that teaches them to allocate 50% of their money for needs, like food and clothing, 30% for wants, such as toys or treats, and 20% for savings . This approach helps children discern between needs and wants while cultivating patience in their financial journey. Make Learning Fun with Board Games: Incorporate board games like Monopoly, Game of Life, etc., into family game nights. These games not only entertain but also impart valuable lessons on financial planning, decision-making, and the significance of saving and investing. Explore Age-Appropriate Books: Invest in age-appropriate books that emphasize the importance of saving and financial responsibility, from colorful stories for younger audiences to more sophisticated guides for older children. Encourage Smart Shopping : Take children along when shopping and show them how to compare prices. Teach them to look for good deals and bargains, instilling resourcefulness and a strong sense of stewardship.

If the world is a giant machine, money is the fuel that keeps it running smoothly. From buying groceries to raising funds, money is at the heart of almost everything we do. That's why understanding how money works is so crucial in today's world.However, in the schoolyard of life, the curriculum often skips over the ABCs of financial literacy .Hence, it becomes imperative for parents to step into the role of headmasters, ensuring their children are equipped with more than just algebra and history. Just as parents meticulously prepare their children for exams and extracurricular activities, they must also take the reins in imparting essential lessons on money management . When one knows how to budget, save, and spend wisely, one is better prepared to handle everyday situations like paying bills, or even planning for big goals like college or a career.Financial literacy isn't just about balancing a checkbook or understanding compound interest; it's about fostering a mindset of prudence, responsibility, and foresight. From an early age, children absorb lessons about money, whether consciously or unconsciously, from their surroundings. Therefore, it's incumbent upon parents, educators, and policymakers to ensure that these lessons are deliberate and conducive to financial well-being. Just as we teach children the alphabet before they can read, we should introduce basic financial concepts before they encounter their first paycheck.Here are practical steps that parents can incorporate into their child-rearing journey to ensure a lifetime of sound financial habits:By instilling financial literacy in children today, we are sowing the seeds for a future where they will grow into financially confident adults, capable of making informed decisions, pursuing their dreams, and contributing meaningfully to society. As these empowered individuals enter the workforce and engage in economic activities, they will not only secure their financial well-being but cultivate a stronger, more resilient economy for generations to come.
Article Summary: Financial literacy isn't just about balancing a checkbook or understanding compound interest. It's about fostering a mindset of prudence, responsibility, and foresight. Key components of hallmark on gold jewellery



Gold, silver hallmarking : Gold and silver jewllery have long been treasured for their beauty and value. However, ensuring their purity and authenticity is important, especially in a market prone to fraudulent practices. This is where the hallmarking scheme comes into play. Here’s what you need to know about hallmarking charges and its procedures:Hallmarking is the process of accurately determining and officially recording the proportionate content of precious metals in articles, such as gold and silver.It serves as a guarantee of their purity or fineness. In India, hallmarking is governed by stringent standards outlined in IS 15820, according to an ET report.Hallmarking charges are applied per article, regardless of its weight. For gold articles, the charge is Rs 45 per article, with a minimum charge of Rs 200 for a consignment. Similarly, for silver articles, the charge is Rs 35 per article, with a minimum charge of Rs 150 for a consignment. It's important to note that additional taxes and levies may apply.A consignment refers to a collection of articles with the same fineness, from which a sample is drawn and assayed for compliance. Different lots may exist within a consignment.Anyone can have their hallmarked jewellery tested for purity at an A&H centre by paying a testing fee of Rs. 200 (for testing using the fire assay method as per IS 1418). These centres must be recognized by the BIS. The list of recognized A&H centres is available on the BIS website under the hallmarking section.The primary objective of hallmarking is to safeguard consumers from counterfeit products. To achieve this, the Indian government made hallmarking mandatory for gold jewellery from June 16, 2021. Since April 1, 2023, jewellers are prohibited from selling any gold jewellery without a 6-digit Hallmark Unique Identification ( HUID ) number.If you bought gold jewellery on or before June 30, 2021, it may have old hallmarking signs. These signs include the purity/fineness mark and the BIS emblem, along with two additional indications: the jeweller's identification number and the assay centre's mark/number.However, starting July 1, 2021, these two indications were replaced with a unique alphanumeric HUID code. The hallmark remains valid for the lifetime of the jewellery, and consumers can sell old jewellery, whether hallmarked or un-hallmarked, to jewellers.The HUID, or hallmark Unique Identification number, is a key component of hallmarking in gold jewellery. It's a unique six-digit alphanumeric code assigned to each hallmarked item, allowing for traceability. Customers can verify the HUID number using the 'Verify HUID' feature in the BIS Care App.Since the introduction of the HUID on July 1, 2021, the hallmark on gold jewellery consists of three marks: the BIS logo, the purity of the article in caratage and fineness, and a unique six-digit alphanumeric HUID number.
Article Summary: Hallmarking is the process of accurately determining and officially recording the proportionate content of precious metals in articles, such as gold and silver. In India, hallmarking is governed by stringent standards outlined in IS 15820. Since April 1, 2023, jewellers are prohibited from selling any gold jewellery without a 6-digit Hallmark Unique Identification number.

Article Title: Apple products lost in the LA fire may not be covered by AppleCare+, here’s why
Article Text:

What AppleCare+ policies say about fire damages



What it means for users



Victims affected by the Los Angeles wildfire who lost their Macs may have to look to their homeowner's insurance for replacement, not AppleCare. While AppleCare offers protection against certain damages, it generally doesn't cover fire damage. The wildfires in California have caused widespread property loss, including homes, businesses, and personal belongings. Thousands of people have been affected, and those needing to replace their Macs will likely find better support through their homeowner's insurance policies. Apple 's AppleCare+ for Mac has specific terms outlining what is and isn't covered for repairs.Similar to other warranties and insurance policies, the agreement clearly states its limitations.The "What is not Covered?" section of the AppleCare+ policy agreement lists scenarios that won’t be covered includes damage caused by "accident, abuse, misuse, liquid contact, fire, earthquake or other external causes." This means damage from fire, or even water damage from firefighting efforts, will not covered.Submitting a Mac for repair or replacement after it has survived a house fire, even if it appears intact externally, will likely be rejected. Additionally, if your house was evacuated as a precaution but left unscathed by the fire, it could still become a target for theft. The policy explicitly states it does not cover "lost or stolen" hardware, noting, "This Plan only covers Covered Equipment that is returned to Apple in its entirety."Apart from this, the company is offering other support to those affected by the LA wildfires. Apple Card users in FEMA-designated disaster areas can defer payments without interest accrual by contacting Apple Card Support.Additionally, Apple CEO Tim Cook announced that Apple is donating to support wildfire victims and recovery efforts.While AppleCare is helpful for typical Mac issues, it's not a comprehensive insurance plan and has limitations. It's designed to cover repairs for specific problems, not for events like natural disasters or theft. For broader protection, insurance is the more appropriate solution.Instead, Mac owners affected by wildfires should turn to homeowner's or renter's insurance, which typically covers property damage and loss, including electronics. Businesses can use property insurance for similar claims, while travellers should review their travel insurance policies for coverage of damaged or lost items.

In 1999, Bill Gates , co-founder of Microsoft and one of the most influential technologists in history, authored a book titled Business @ the Speed of Thought. The book contained 15 bold predictions that at the time seemed almost too futuristic to come true. However, as the world has advanced over the past two decades, these predictions have not only materialised but have become integral to modern life.Bill Gates’ foresight, based on emerging technologies, offers a fascinating lens into how the digital revolution was shaping up, even before many of its most transformative tools existed.One of Gates' first predictions was the development of automated price-comparison tools. He foresaw a world where consumers could effortlessly compare prices across multiple websites to find the cheapest options for products and services. Today, this prediction is a reality with platforms like Google Shopping, PriceGrabber, and Honey, which streamline the shopping experience by providing price comparisons and discounts across industries.Gates envisioned small, portable devices that would enable constant connectivity, allowing people to check news, manage finances, and perform everyday tasks. This prediction perfectly describes today’s smartphones and tablets, which have become indispensable for modern communication, commerce, and information consumption. Devices like the iPhone, introduced in 2007, revolutionized how we interact with technology and turned Gates’ vision into a universal reality.According to Gates, people would manage their finances and communicate with doctors over the internet. Platforms such as PayPal, Venmo, and Google Pay have made instant online payments a standard part of life, while telemedicine apps like Teladoc and Practo allow patients to consult with doctors remotely. These innovations have not only simplified everyday life but have also democratized access to essential services.Another prediction involved "personal companions" that could sync all devices and help manage schedules, purchases, and data sharing. This concept is embodied in today’s digital assistants like Siri, Alexa, and Google Assistant. Integrated with the Internet of Things (IoT), these assistants control smart devices, streamline home management, and adapt to users’ needs, making daily routines more efficient.Gates anticipated the use of constant video feeds for home monitoring, a feature that has gained massive popularity through smart security systems like Ring and Nest. These systems allow homeowners to monitor their properties remotely, receive real-time alerts, and maintain peace of mind, showcasing how Gates’ vision has translated into practical solutions for home security.In 1999, Gates predicted private online spaces where friends and family could interact and plan events. Social media platforms like Facebook, Instagram, and WhatsApp have taken this concept even further, enabling people worldwide to connect, share, and communicate in real time.Gates foresaw software capable of analyzing travel plans and providing personalized promotional offers, discounts, and activity suggestions. Today, platforms like Expedia and TripAdvisor do exactly that, using AI algorithms to tailor recommendations based on user preferences and travel history.Gates imagined services that would allow real-time discussions during live sports broadcasts. Platforms like Twitter and specialized apps like ESPN and Hotstar have made this a reality, enabling fans to engage, predict outcomes, and even interact with commentators during live events.The concept of personalized advertising, which Gates predicted, is now a cornerstone of modern marketing. Platforms like Google and Facebook use advanced algorithms and user data to deliver ads tailored to individual preferences, maximizing their relevance and impact.Gates predicted that TV broadcasts would include links to related online content. This is evident in today’s streaming platforms like Netflix and Amazon Prime, where viewers can access trailers, behind-the-scenes content, and even shop for items featured in their favorite shows.The prediction that the internet would host discussions on local and global issues has come true with platforms like Reddit, Quora, and city-specific forums. These sites provide spaces for users to share opinions and collaborate on topics ranging from local politics to global challenges.Gates foresaw online communities forming based on shared interests rather than geographical proximity. Platforms like LinkedIn, Pinterest, and niche forums have enabled people to connect with others who share their hobbies, passions, and professional goals.The idea of project managers finding skilled team members online has been realized through platforms like Trello, Asana, and Jira. These tools streamline team collaboration and project execution, making them essential for modern businesses.Gates predicted that job seekers would declare their skills and preferences online to find suitable employment. Platforms like LinkedIn and Indeed have turned this prediction into reality, revolutionizing how people search for and secure jobs.The final prediction envisioned companies bidding on projects or jobs through online platforms. Websites like Upwork and Freelancer have made this process seamless, connecting businesses with freelancers and specialized service providers to complete diverse projects efficiently.
Article Summary: In 1999, Bill Gates authored a book titled Business @ the Speed of Thought. The book contained 15 bold predictions that at the time seemed almost too futuristic to come true. As the world has advanced over the past two decades, these predictions have not only materialised but have become integral to modern life.

The Maha Kumbh 2025 in Prayagraj, one of the world’s largest religious gatherings, has taken a technological leap forward with the launch of the multi-lingual AI chatbot Kumbh Sah'AI'yak . This groundbreaking initiative was unveiled on December 13, 2024, by Prime Minister Narendra Modi and Uttar Pradesh Chief Minister Yogi Adityanath as part of the "Digital Mahakumbh" vision.Designed to enhance the experience of millions of devotees and visitors, the chatbot represents a blend of tradition and cutting-edge technology, ensuring seamless support throughout the 45-day event.Kumbh Sah'AI'yak is an advanced generative AI tool designed to act as a virtual companion for pilgrims attending the Maha Kumbh Mela. The chatbot provides a wide array of services, including real-time updates, event schedules, travel guidance, and personalized assistance. Built with multi-lingual capabilities, it caters to a diverse audience, making it accessible to pilgrims from across India and the world. Its primary goal is to simplify navigation, enhance security, and offer an immersive cultural experience for attendees.The chatbot was developed by the Prayagraj Mela Authority in collaboration with the Uttar Pradesh Development Systems Corporation (UPDESCO) and is powered by an open-source large language model (LLM) provided by Ola's AI division, Krutrim, under the leadership of Bhavish Aggarwal. To ensure security and reliability, stringent privacy measures have been implemented, addressing concerns about data misuse and misinformation.Kumbh Sah'AI'yak is packed with features that make it an invaluable tool for pilgrims and tourists alike. Supporting 11 major Indian languages, including Hindi, Tamil, Telugu, Marathi, and Bengali, the chatbot integrates seamlessly with the Bhashini app to ensure communication in regional languages. It also offers voice and text interaction modes, making it user-friendly for individuals with varying levels of digital literacy.Integrated with Google Maps, the chatbot assists visitors in locating key sites such as bathing ghats, temples, akharas, railway stations, bus terminals, and parking zones. It also provides historical and cultural context about the Kumbh Mela, enriching attendees’ understanding of its traditions and spiritual significance.For those planning their visit, Kumbh Sah'AI'yak offers comprehensive information about government-approved tour packages, local accommodations, and sightseeing options. This includes a curated list of hotels, homestays, and other lodging options to suit various budgets. Visitors can also access event updates and safety advisories in real-time, ensuring a secure and well-informed experience.To reach the widest possible audience, the chatbot is available on the official Maha Kumbh 2025 mobile app, website, and even on WhatsApp. This multi-platform availability ensures that pilgrims from all walks of life can access its features with ease. Whether tech-savvy or new to digital tools, every attendee can rely on the chatbot for guidance.The Maha Kumbh 2025 is set to be a historic event, spanning six weeks from January 13 to February 26. Held every 12 years, this year’s festival is expected to attract over 450 million visitors, including both domestic and international attendees. This staggering number underscores the significance of the Kumbh Mela, not only as a spiritual gathering but also as a logistical marvel. The integration of AI through Kumbh Sah'AI'yak will play a crucial role in managing the massive influx of pilgrims, ensuring a smooth and memorable experience for all.
Article Summary: Kumbh Sah'AI'yak is an advanced generative AI tool designed to act as a virtual companion for pilgrims attending the Maha Kumbh Mela. The chatbot provides a wide array of services, including real-time updates, event schedules, travel guidance, and personalized assistance.

Microsoft 365 Copilot Chat: What is it and how it works



“new offering that adds pay-as-you-go agents to our existing free chat experience for Microsoft 365 commercial customers. Copilot Chat enables your entire workforce—from customer service representatives to marketing leads to frontline technicians—to start using Copilot and agents today.”

Microsoft has launched a new consumption-based pricing tier for its Microsoft 365 Copilot AI assistant. This new service will offer businesses an alternative to the existing per-user subscription model. This move aims to accelerate the adoption of generative AI in the workplace. The new "Chat" option will allow organisations to pay for Copilot based on usage, rather than the number of employees with access.Microsoft CEO Satya Nadella took to social media platform X (earlier Twitter) to announce the new model.In a blog post, Microsoft explains that thisMicrosoft 365 Copilot Chat includes:This AI-driven product lineup combines Copilot Chat and Microsoft 365 Copilot to enhance productivity and collaboration across organisations. These tools integrate advanced AI capabilities with everyday workflows, offering tailored solutions for smarter, faster and more efficient work processes.Copilot Chat serves as the core user interface for AI interactions, powered by GPT-4o and grounded in web-based knowledge. It enables users to perform tasks such as market research, strategy creation, and meeting preparation. With the ability to upload files, users can ask Copilot to summarize Word documents, analyze Excel spreadsheets, or enhance PowerPoint presentations. Additionally, Copilot Pages allows real-time collaboration with AI and human input, incorporating content from files, web sources, and AI-generated images for campaigns or social media.The lineup also introduces Agents, which allow users to automate repetitive tasks using natural language commands. For instance, a customer service representative can retrieve CRM data, while field service workers can access step-by-step instructions or real-time product knowledge. IT administrators can create and manage agents across the organization using Microsoft Copilot Studio , ensuring customisation and control. These agents are offered on a metered pricing model, maintaining flexibility for businesses.To ensure security and control, the Copilot Control System includes enterprise data protection, access management, usage tracking, and lifecycle governance. These foundational capabilities empower IT teams to oversee AI integration securely and effectively.On top of this, Microsoft 365 Copilot builds on Copilot Chat’s features, combining GPT-4o with work-specific data from meetings, emails, and documents. Integrated with Microsoft 365 apps like Teams, Outlook, Word, Excel, and PowerPoint, it enhances everyday workflows while introducing new tools such as Copilot Actions to address workplace challenges. Additionally, Copilot Analytics helps measure impact and ROI, making it easier for organisations to evaluate their AI investments.This approach is designed to drive large-scale AI transformation, offering enhanced productivity while prioritising security, efficiency and IT control.Customers can get started with either the free or paid experience of Microsoft 365 Copilot Chat in the Microsoft 365 Copilot app. The app is available at m365copilot.com or in the Windows, Android, or iPhone app stores.
Article Summary: Microsoft has launched a new consumption-based pricing tier for its Microsoft 365 Copilot AI assistant. This new service will offer businesses an alternative to the existing per-user subscription model. Microsoft CEO Satya Nadella took to social media platform X (earlier Twitter) to announce the new model.

The iconic animated series The Simpsons has long fascinated fans for its uncanny ability to seemingly predict real-world events. From smartwatches to global political developments, the show’s creators have unintentionally earned a reputation as time-traveling prophets. Adding to this legacy is a bizarre new claim that has taken social media by storm.A viral video suggests that The Simpsons foretold a global internet outage on January 16, 2025. While many dismiss it as lighthearted entertainment, the rumor has sparked curiosity and humour online.The viral video, which claims to be from an episode of The Simpsons, suggests a complete internet shutdown coinciding with Donald Trump’s inauguration as U.S. President. The video humorously attributes this global outage to a white shark chewing through an underwater cable, blending absurdity with speculation. Adding to the inaccuracies is the claim that this event aligns with Trump’s inauguration, which is officially scheduled for January 20, 2025, rather than January 16. Despite these glaring errors, the video has captivated viewers, sparking debates, memes, and jokes across platforms.The online reaction to the supposed prediction has been overwhelmingly humourous. Social media users have shared their comedic takes, with one user joking about running out of mobile data and another commenting, “If this happens, I’ll finally get a break from work-from-home!” While the majority see the claim for what it is—a fabricated tale meant for laughs—it has undeniably entertained millions. The video has also reignited discussions about how The Simpsons continues to influence pop culture through its seemingly prescient content.While the shark-chewing-cable scenario in the video adds to the absurdity of the claim, it does touch upon a real-world issue: marine life occasionally interfering with underwater internet cables. Instances of sharks and other sea creatures damaging these cables have been documented, prompting tech companies to reinforce their infrastructure. For example, Google has taken measures to wrap its undersea cables with materials similar to Kevlar, reducing the likelihood of damage caused by marine animals. However, such incidents are highly localized and unlikely to trigger a global outage.

Article Title: The Backstory You Need to Know About the WWE Royal Rumble
Article Text:
Image via WWE

From its inception to streaming live on multiple platforms, WWE Royal Rumble has come a long way

Royal Rumble has become an integral part of WWE history and is one of the four major events that the company hosts every year. If we are to look at a year for the company, then Royal Rumbles are always followed up by a WrestleMania, which is the grandest event for the company.Over the years, as the company has evolved, the event itself has evolved and the match that derives its name from the event itself has also changed significantly.So, here’s how WWE Royal Rumble has evolved over the years.The event and the match itself started back in 1988, where 20 men competed in the ring to secure a championship match for themselves. The match was won by “Hacksaw” Jim Duggal and was also broadcasted on the USA Network.This format of wrestling was interesting to a great extent and primed the stage for future events. However, the match itself wouldn't be here if it weren't for Pat Patterson. He was the one who came up with the concept of the over the top elimination match.This trend continued for a while and featured some really amazing matches, but mostly comprised of male wrestlers only. It was only until 2018 when the match was held for women too, which was important to establish their position as a strong wrestling segment which in turn gave the women of WWE more screen time, an important milestone in the world of professional wrestling.The match itself has received a lot of attention too, but the event is soon going to become international. For example, so far, WWE has hosted Royal Rumble in locations all across US and Canada. However, in 2026, the event will make a move to Saudi Arabia for the first time in its history.Saudi Arabia is shaping up to be a strong wrestling destination but WWE holds a dedicated event there every year. However, with Royal Rumble moving to the country, it’ll make Saudi Arabia an even more important piece of WWE’s history moving forward.2025’s Royal Rumble is also shaping up to be an important event because it’ll feature some really important wrestlers in the match. John Cena and Roman Reigns have already announced their candidacy for the events, which makes them two high profile contenders. Cena will be looking to secure his 17th World Championship victory, while Reigns will be looking to take back his championship from Cody Rhodes. It’ll be interesting to see how things pan out moving forward.With that being said, WWE’s Royal Rumble match has played an extremely important role in crowning champions, and will continue to do so for years to come.
Article Summary: WWE Royal Rumble will move to Saudi Arabia for the first time in its history in 2026. John Cena and Roman Reigns have already announced their candidacy for the event. Royal Rumble has become an integral part of WWE history and is one of the four major events that the company hosts every year.
